text: I have went to the end of the day so
many times and prayed that I wouldn't
use the next day for so many years and I
always ended up with the same results
the next day the disease had such a grip
on me that I couldn't stop all's I did
was lifting used and used to live it's a
terrible feeling when you come to the
point in your life that you surrender
you're automatically planting a seed for
a new way of living well the concept
behind the farm is a work program for
men who are homeless I the New York City
shelter system or Street homeless and
they all have our fighting addiction and
it part of the community of men living
together to do accomplish the same goals
so there's a senescence energy going on
between them to reinforce each other
sobriety and reinforce what they want to
accomplish to move on and get out of the
system of homelessness of addiction I
don't know if if I could have done this
so far on my own when we working with
the plants out here we we're not really
in control what we do is that we we
become the vessel to plant the seeds
it's it relates to life how the process
of living and that our growth process is
really the same we have to be nurtured
have to be taken care of and we have to
have the desire to want to live to grow
I now see that the life I have is
valuable if I value it and nurture it
that I can do make a difference be
responsible do my part in humanity
that's enough addiction is a disease it
is definitely a disease that will kill
you it will kill me if I give in to the
disease but on a day at a time I can
have control over that disease if I
don't use what it means to have another
chances it's it's like being born again
it's like being born all over again and
having another chance in life
